output.conclusion: By completing this MLOps course, you'll be equipped with the knowledge and skills to streamline your machine learning workflows, automate deployments, and ensure the reliability and scalability of your ML models in production.
output.courseTitle: MLOps: Automating and Scaling Machine Learning Workflows
output.introduction: Welcome to the MLOps course! This course is designed for intermediate-level machine learning practitioners who want to learn how to automate and scale their ML workflows. We'll cover essential MLOps concepts, tools, and best practices to help you build robust and reliable ML systems.

chapters.description: Overview of MLOps principles, benefits, and its role in the ML lifecycle. Discussing the challenges of deploying and maintaining ML models in production.
Comparing and contrasting MLOps with DevOps. Highlighting the unique aspects of MLOps, such as data versioning, model validation, and continuous training.
Detailed walkthrough of the MLOps lifecycle stages: data engineering, model development, deployment, monitoring, and governance.
Introduction to Data Version Control (DVC) for managing and tracking data changes. Setting up DVC and versioning datasets.
Understanding the purpose and benefits of feature stores. Exploring different types of feature stores and their architectures.
Implementing data validation techniques to ensure data quality. Monitoring data drift and anomalies in production.
Building automated model training pipelines using tools like Kubeflow Pipelines or MLflow. Orchestrating training jobs and managing dependencies.
Using MLflow to track experiments, log parameters, and compare model performance. Managing model versions and artifacts.
Implementing robust model evaluation metrics and validation strategies. Ensuring model generalization and preventing overfitting.
Exploring different model deployment strategies: batch prediction, online prediction, and shadow deployment. Choosing the right strategy for your use case.
Containerizing ML models using Docker for consistent and reproducible deployments. Building Docker images and managing dependencies.
Deploying and scaling ML models using Kubernetes. Setting up Kubernetes clusters and managing deployments.
Implementing model monitoring to track performance metrics and detect anomalies. Setting up logging and alerting systems.
Automating the ML pipeline with CI/CD. Setting up CI/CD pipelines for model training, testing, and deployment.
Discussing MLOps best practices for security, governance, and collaboration. Ensuring compliance and ethical considerations.
